INVALIDITY OF A WILL
(1) A will shall be rendered invalid when the testator was under threat or duress to write the will or when he or she decided to write it with fraudulent intent or because he or she was in error.
(2) Threat, duress or fraud on part of a third person shall also result in a will being invalidated.
(3) Testamentary dispositions shall also be invalid when the testator is mistaken as to the facts that led him or her to such dispositions.
(4) When only some of the provisions of a will have been written under threat or duress, with fraudulent intent, or in error, only the provisions in question shall be invalid.
